items.text: presses forward to a length ball and defends into the covers

items.text: short, sits up nicely outside off, Rahmat rocks back and pulls between mid-on and midwicket
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Rahmat Shah, FOUR runs

items.text: fullish outside off, eases into a push to mid-off
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Rahmat Shah, no run

items.text: full, angles into off, pushes off the front foot down the pitch. Does so very gently and the ball stops in its tracks right before the boundary

items.text: swats a pull to a short ball between mid-on and midwicket
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Mohammad Shahzad, 2 runs

items.preText: vijay: "What's the basis for classifying the quicks as fast, fast medium, medium fast, etc?" As far as my knowledge goes, medium fast is used to describe someone who averages between 130 and 135, fast-medium: 135-140, and 140-plus is fast.
items.text: fullish, strides forward and pushes towards mid-off
items.shortText: Abu Hider to Rahmat Shah, no run

items.text: short outside off, mistimes a pull to square leg
items.shortText: Abu Hider to Rahmat Shah, no run

items.preText: Fawaz Zacky: "@Sravan & @Manoj: Most of Rashid's wicket came against associate teams, Murali had to fight against greatest of crickets such as Sachin,Sehwag,Dravid,Ponting,Lara,Kallis,Gibbs,Inzi,fleming, etc to achieve that milestone. Without any doubt 90/2000s batsmen are greater than this decade."
items.text: short, too high for him as he swings and misses
items.shortText: Abu Hider to Rahmat Shah, no run

items.text: comes forward to a length ball and gets an inside edge to midwicket
items.shortText: Abu Hider to Rahmat Shah, no run

items.preText: Been wondering why we aren't seeing big scores in the Asia Cup? Ajit Agarkar has the answer on ESPNcricinfo Match Day. Watch the video here.
items.text: off-stump pegged back. Creates a beautiful angle after drawing the batsman forward with a length ball. Angles it into his off-stump and the ball comes on with the arm to go past the inside edge as the batsman leaves daylight between bat and body
items.shortText: Abu Hider to Rahmat Shah, OUT

dismissal.text: Rahmat Shah  b Abu Hider 10 (17b 1x4 0x6) SR: 58.82

items.preText: Hari: "Guys, have some mercy. One of our friends, few mins ago, put forward the point that conditions are in favour of batsmen in LOIs. It's true. Considering that, Rashid's efforts needs to be appreciated.. "
